title: Normal profit is return equal to opportunity cost

content.question: If a perfectly competitive industry is in long-run equilibrium, which of the following is most likely to be true?

choices.label: Some firms can be expected to leave the industry.
Individual firms are not operating at the minimum points on their average total cost curves.
Firms are earning a return on investment that is equal to their opportunity costs.
Some factors are not receiving a return equal to their opportunity costs.

content.answer: Firms are earning a return on investment that is equal to their opportunity costs.
